result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Comply with all conditions of the plea agreement

Case not called on the record.
Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael A Maletz in court. 
Defendant's first appearance in Drug Treatment Court. Court explains rules and outlines expectations of the defendant while in the program.  Defendant is ordered to comply with the rules, expectations and instructions/orders or they will be subject to sanctions including placement on the weekly sanction list or immediate incarceration.
Waukesha County Drug Treatment Court Diversion Contract;  signed on 05-23-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III
Review hearing on May 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 2:55 PM 
Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael A Maletz in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter. 
Court reviews the case on the record and notes that the defendant is entering into a Drug Treatment Court Contract.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.
Court accepts plea as, knowlingly, intelligently, and voluntarily made.
Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC.
Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contact.  Review hearing scheduled for May 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on May 23, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
proposed Waukesha County Drug Treatment Court Diversion Contract;  filed by Atty. Allison Ritter
filed by Atty. Allison Ritter

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Ritter states they have received an offer for DTC Court and request a plea hearing date.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:26 AM Defendant Michael A Maletz in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request to adjourn initial
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 03-29-2022. Granted.
